Padded.description: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

Leather.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil.

Studded Leather.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Hide.description: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts.

Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather.

Scale Mail.description: This armor consists of a coat and leggings of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish.

Breastplate.description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather.

Half Plate.description: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body.

Ring Mail.description: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it.

Chain Mail.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath to prevent chafing and cushion the impact of blows.

Splint.description: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding.

Plate.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body.
